name: Hackeye IOS App
description:
Finder app that points you to the nearest hardware-inspired project meetup for collaboration:

1. Designed custom UI pages and developed front-end features in Xcode/Swift

2. Processed multi-location data and provide project suggestions based on proximity

3. Scraped project data using REST API and implemented full mobile pagination

Languages and Frameworks: Swift, Xcode, CoreLocation, Hackaday API

name: Hackeye.io
description:
An extension for Hackaday.io that provides project and user info:

1. Custom SVG animations for landing and loading page logo and titles

2. No-reload pagination of project items with custom URLs for each page

3. User tooltip displaying profile name, rank and motivations on hover

Languages and Frameworks: Node Js, Tweenmax, GSAP, EJS, NightWatch, Heroku

name: Easy Tour
description:
Developed an AI web app for Tourism that maps out your trip for you (LA Hacks 2018):

1. Implemented color-to-emotion model using Google Vision to tag Flickr photos

2. Performed RESTful API calls and CRUD operations to JSON files using Node.js

3. Rendered 3-D interactive map routes using HTML and MapBox GL JS

Languages and Frameworks: : HTML/CSS, Node.js, Google Cloud Vision, Flickr API, MapBox API

name: Pi for Parkinson's
description:
Assistive Medical IoT Device and Software for Parkinson's Patients:

1. Led a team of 3 to create a medically assistive IoT device for Parkinson's Patients

2. Using Raspberry Pi, IMU, and servo technology, read live data using python program to correct resting tremor symptoms

3. Developed beautiful front end dashboard to chart live Firebase data

Languages and Frameworks: JQuery, Chart.js, Firebase, Python

name: UCSD A Cappella Choir
description:
UCSD A Cappella Choir website created with bootstrap, JQuery, and hosted on UCSD web server:

1. Used bootstrap to create a professional UI/UX web layout including event, schedule, profile, FAQ and contact pages

2. Customized features to fit organization's primary advertising needs

3. Implemented interactive read-and-listen webpage content to help members learn their song parts

Languages and Frameworks: Bootstrap CSS/JS, JQuery

name: Doris' Designer Portfolio
description:
Commissioned by a friend to create her Interior Design portfolio:

1. Integrated UI features such as background parallax, Navbars, and more

2. Integrated mobile functionalities such as collapsible and draggable sidenav

3. Created fullscreen modal sliders using carousels and overlays

Languages and Frameworks: Materialize CSS/JS, JQuery

name: LifeWatch 2.0
description:
VR Lifeguard trainer created with Unity, SteamVR, and VIVE (SD Hacks 2017):

1. Created VR UI/UX environment using Unity objects and packages

2. Programmed VIVE controller and Unity object functionalities in C#

3. Worked in team of 4 and submitted to SD Hacks 2018

Languages and Frameworks: Unity, SteamVR API, VIVE, C#

name: Hi-Kinnect
description:
Hi-Kinect is a prototype mobile hiking app (MYC 2016):

1. Created business plan and drafted prototype UI/UX features for app-based mock startup

2. Planned to integrate Google Maps API and the city's Open Data Catalogue to help hikers navigate trails with more awareness

3. Placed 3rd out of 25 Teams and won $250 at Calgary's Mayor's Youth Council Hack-a-thon 2017

Languages and Frameworks: Wix sites and Proto.io design software

name: Connect Four
description:
Full stack Connect Four using Java:

1. Programmed front end and back end using JavaFx/Java

2. Implemented Press N to Restart/Clear game feature

3. Project from Luminerva Inc work experience

Languages and Frameworks used: Java, JavaFx
